meta_homepage_title: Independent Developer - Custom Apps & Honest Pricing
meta_homepage_description: Independent developer. No agency fees! I build custom apps and websites with high performance. Transparent pricing and fast delivery.
hero_title: Custom Solutions Directly Built. Expert Work,
hero_description: I cut out the agency noise and focus entirely on building your custom website or app. Expect transparent pricing, dedicated attention, and a straightforward path to launch.
bento_1_description: While I'm not a "Senior" developer with 20 years of legacy habits, I bring maximum focus and knowledge of the most efficient modern tech. You get reliable, clean code without paying for outdated experience.
bento_2_description: I don't have an agency office or a sales team—your budget goes straight into the build, not into corporate costs.
bento_3_description: We define the scope clearly upfront, and I manage my time to ensure a rapid launch that's reliable, not just rushed.
bento_4_description: Whether you need a simple, solid marketing site or a mid-size web app with complex data, I build platforms that meet your current needs and scale when your business is ready.
tools_title: The Modern Tech Stack I Master
tools_subtitle: A curated toolkit built for speed and scalability.
tools_instruction: Hover/Tap on any card to see how I use it.
tools_instruction_fallback: Hover/Tap on a tool for more details
tool_solidjs_description: I fell in love with SolidJS, and I'm planning to base all my future projects on it. I'm even thinking about making my own component library.
tool_tanstack_start_description: Not everyone knows this, but Tanstack Start is compatible with SolidJS. I use it alongside Solid for powerful full-stack applications.
tool_tailwindcss_description: This is my primary way of styling projects. I occasionally use inline styles, but only for reactive states.
tool_react_description: I started with React around 2022. It was my go-to library because of the ecosystem, but eventually, it felt like too much bloatware for my taste.
tool_nextjs_description: After React, Next.js was the natural next step. I used it for my first full-stack app. Great experience, but again—a lot of bloat.
tool_convex_description: I just started using Convex and I love it. They recently secured $22M in funding, so I'm excited to see their future features.
tool_tanstack_query_description: The team at Tanstack made a SolidJS version of this, so I'm definitely going to use it where it's needed.
tool_drizzle_description: When I started working with databases, I picked up Drizzle immediately. I really like it—it's a fantastic ORM for TypeScript.
tool_supabase_description: I've used Supabase for a few projects, so I'm familiar with it, but truthfully, I didn't love it.
tool_postgresql_description: I used this in University and on personal projects. It's powerful, but I want to build fast—so I'm leaning more toward Convex.
tool_typescript_description: What can I say? I use it for everything. Sometimes it gets a little verbose, but the safety is worth it.
tool_javascript_description: I can't say I use it directly, but everything is built on it... so I guess I am using it?
tool_css_description: I started with raw CSS. It's flexible, powerful, and honestly very easy to use once you get the hang of it.
tool_romanian_description: Well, I'm Romanian, so I believe I know it :)).
tool_english_description: I have a C1 certificate from Cambridge, so I can definitely have a conversation about video games with you.
tool_bun_description: I use Bun everywhere. It's incredibly fast and efficient, both as a package manager and a runtime.
tool_github_description: I've used GitHub for ages and I still feel like I don't know half of it. But I like it a lot.
tool_git_description: I mean, you can't have GitHub without Git, can you?
tool_nodejs_description: Node.js is classic and still used for many things, but personally, I prefer Bun.
tool_turborepo_description: I love the idea of Turborepo. After I build my component library, I'll be using this for faster builds.
tool_pnpm_description: My second package manager was pnpm. It's fast and efficient, though I still prefer Bun.
tool_npm_description: This was the first package manager I ever used, so I'm still fond of it for nostalgic reasons.
tool_figma_description: I use Figma heavily for UI/UX design and prototyping. It's powerful, though it is getting a bit pricey.
tool_zed_description: I started using this recently and I love it. The Zed agent is amazing, though it still needs some updates on Windows.
tool_vscode_description: I think it's the best editor for web dev. Lots of extensions and easy to use. It's free, though Copilot is sort of pricey.
tool_intellij_description: I used this for Java development in University. I also tried making some Minecraft mods with it :)
projects_pensiunea_description: Live application built with Next.js and the Bun runtime for maximum performance. Full ownership includes Figma design, SEO, and robust multilingual features via Next-Intl. Proof of my end-to-end reliability.
projects_more_coming: More projects are arriving, so stay tuned!
hero_seo_expertise: Expert in SolidJS, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and modern web development
projects_seo_description: Showcasing my latest web development projects with modern technologies and best practices
bento_seo_description: Discover the advantages of working directly with an independent developer
